After the meeting, Straight Shot too, walks the corridors alone, a bit a fa=
r from Wheelie and the other Maximals and Autobots.  She quietly opens the =
door where the sleeping Autobots lie and enters the room quietly.  Upon ent=
ering she first stops to pay her respects to her sleeping commander, Optimu=
s Prime.

" Hello Sir, I would never come in without addressing you first, =
Optimus.  Now, I hope ya don't mind but, there's someone here I promised ta=
 visit every day and he's waiting for me.  Rest well Sir."

She puts her ti=
ny hand down gently on Optimus Prime's right hand and bids him good bye.  S=
he then locates the Autobot she came to see.  She approaches an older comra=
de, in red and white armor and kneels down beside him.  She heaves a sigh a=
s she looks to his face.  If anyone played a major role in her life as well=
 as Tucson's, it was this Autobot, who was often known for his cranky dispo=
sition by those who did not know him as Straight Shot and Tucson, who consi=
dered him their mentor.

" Sorry I'm late, Ratchet, I had ta attend a manda=
tory meeting.  Oh, Tucson finally wants ta get his optic sensors repaired b=
ut you're the only medic who's done enough extensive examination ta do the =
proceedure.  I can't trust my brother's eyes to just anyone, I was hoping y=
ou would be around ta do the repairs. "

She puts her tiny hands on Ratchet=
's hands' looking to him as tears glitter from her optics.  

" But most of=
 all Ratchet, I miss you for who you are and not just for what you're good =
at.  Tucson misses you too, we practically developed around you. Not everyo=
ne would allow a couple of rookies to work with them as their apprentices. =
 But there you were, willing to take us in no matter what.  I hope you come=
 online soon, I miss you."

She sits quietly beside Ratchet's body, still w=
ith her hands on his.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Ju=
l 8, 2011, at 7:25 PM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@...> wrote:

> 
> 
> =
> BIC:
> > 
> > Tucson nods and turns to get ready for a little alone time =
with Talon.
> > 
> > Yet he turns back to Wheelie.
> > 
> > " If that's wha=
t you want, that's fine by me, Wheelie. But keep in mind, it doesn't hurt t=
o have a friend as well as a comrade by your side. I learned that many vorn=
s ago when I started working with the Autobots. And yes war is a difficult =
time and we can not weaken our defenses but, it doesn't mean we have to be =
anti social either. Strength is in numbers. That was one of Master Yokitron=
's words."
> > 
> > Tucson backs into his private quarters and closes the d=
oor softly.
> > 
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Wheelie paused, "Who was this YOketron, an=
d why should I care what he had on? If he had words, then fine to this day.=
 But they don't matter not to one who does not hede them anyway."
> 
> Then=
, going to head off towards the other corridors of the ship, intent on some=
thing that the small carbot would do when he was alon e and over with himse=
lf.
> 
>
